class.name: VirtualJoystick
class.description: [VirtualJoystick] is a GUI control that simulates an analog stick in a fixed position. For a dynamic joystick that appears at the touch position, use [VirtualJoystickDynamic]. It emits [InputEventVirtualMotion] events for axes 0 (X) and 1 (Y).

method.name: get_output
method.description: Returns the current normalized output vector of the joystick.

method.name: set_joystick_mode
method.description: Sets the behavior mode of the joystick. Internal use mostly, as specific nodes ([VirtualJoystick], [VirtualJoystickDynamic]) set their appropriate mode.

members.member: Modulate color for the joystick base.

The maximum distance the joystick tip can move, as a multiplier of the base radius. A value of 1.0 means the tip stays within the base circle. A value of 1.5 (default) allows the tip to extend halfway beyond the base circle. Range: 0.5 to 2.0.
The radius of the center deadzone as a percentage of the base radius. Movement within this zone is ignored. Range: 0.0 to 0.15.
The hand this joystick is designed for. Affects the virtual axis indices (0/1 for Left, 2/3 for Right).
Modulate color for the joystick tip (handle).
The scale of the tip relative to the base radius (0.01 to 1.0).

constants.constant: The joystick remains in a fixed position.
The joystick appears at the position where the screen is touched.
Left hand. Uses virtual axes 0 and 1.
Right hand. Uses virtual axes 2 and 3.
